definition: the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: The hunchback in the corner by the wall exulted.
sentences.chinese: 壁角的駝背忽然高興起來。

sentences.english: He put the crouch-back♠ onstage, and sold tickets.
sentences.chinese: 他把這個駝背怪物搬上臺，賣票給人看。

sentences.english: When I looked down the hall I saw what looked like a transparent hunchback limping toward us.
sentences.chinese: 我向下看，看到一個駝背的跛子向我們走來。

sentences.english: This is the truth that this hunchbacked old man has taught us.
sentences.chinese: 這就是這位駝背老人告訴我們的道理。

sentences.english: Japanese whale hunters plan to capture 50 humpback whales in the Antarctic in the coming months.
sentences.chinese: 日本捕鯨者計劃下月在南極捕捉50頭駝背鯨。

sentences.english: Abnormal rearward curvature of the spine, resulting in protuberance of the upper back; hunchback.
sentences.chinese: 脊柱後凸，駝背脊椎不正常地向後彎曲，導致。
一個站得挺直，一個駝背。

sentences.english: Happy Tom Crump, never sees his own hump.
sentences.chinese: 快樂的湯克雷，從不曾看到自己的駝背。

sentences.english: The king of the country was a little old hunchback man.
sentences.chinese: 此地的國王是一個駝背小老頭。

sentences.english: So far, the distant person that disguise dresses up is bow-backed show a body eventually.
sentences.chinese: 至此，喬裝打扮的遼人駝背終於現身。

sentences.english: I recognized her, a hunched, frozen figure in an old overcoat standing by a juice cart.
sentences.chinese: 我認她，一個駝背，凍結人物舊大衣站在汁車。

sentences.english: This humpback mother whale still loves her freaky albino baby.
sentences.chinese: 駝背鯨媽媽仍然愛着她的白化病寶寶。

sentences.english: An adolescent humpback whale in mid-pirouette.
sentences.chinese: 用中腳尖旋轉着的青春期駝背鯨。

sentences.english: The fleet was to kill 50 humpbacks for scientific research.
sentences.chinese: 船隊曾經殺死50條駝背鯨做科學研究。

sentences.english: The young man with a hump still said, nodding his head.
Have you noticed that some older women and men have a stooped posture?
sentences.chinese: 你注意到一些老年女性和男性的駝背嗎？

definition: everything steady and stable (idiom); overcautious and unimaginary
to sit cross-legged/to sit in the lotus position
cervical vertebra/the seven cervical vertebrae in the neck of humans and most mammals
